info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 11:31AM EDT until June 13 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston.
* WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1130 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated scattered to numerous showers and thunderstorms with torrential rainfall impacting much of lower Charleston County. Although the region of heaviest rainfall has shifted east of the warning area, conditions remain favorable for additional showers and thunderstorms to develop over portions of Meggett, Yonges Island and Johns Island through early this afternoon. Between 4 and 7 inches of rain fell earlier today with as much as an inch occurring late this morning. An additional 1 to 2 inches could fall through 130 PM as more thunderstorms develop. The risk for flooding continues. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Johns Island, Hollywood, Meggett and Yonges Island.
info.instruction: Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
